page.title: 13Recreation _ Windsurfing.
page.content: Old gravel pits at 2939 are flooded and their banks carefully maintained. Windsurfing, an increasingly popular watersport takes place here along with canoeing. When done properly windsurfing is a strenuous sport requiring superb fitness. A flat piece of fibreglass and one sail make up the 'board'. The surfer stands on this and varies the position of the sail to direct the board and keep his balance. The local comprehensive school (296384) pupils make use of the pits for canoe instruction _ part of the Duke of Edinburgh Award Scheme.
